sentences.en: "Somebody would have seen her." — "I doubt it, not on Monday."
sentences.cn: “可能有人见过她。”——“我认为不可能，不可能在星期一。”

sentences.en: "When roughly would this be? Monday?"— 'Something like that.'
sentences.cn: “大概会在什么时候？星期一？”——“差不多吧。”

sentences.en: A meeting has been called for Monday.
Broughton took a sickie on Monday to paint his fence.
sentences.cn: 布劳顿星期一称病请了一天假来粉刷栅栏。

sentences.en: By Monday, Senor Menem had returned, apparently fired with new determination.
sentences.cn: 到星期一时梅嫩先生已经回来了，显然他又燃起了新的决心。

sentences.en: His shop is open Monday through Friday, 9am to 6pm.
sentences.cn: 他的店周一到周五、每天上午9点到下午6点对外营业。

sentences.en: I am getting married on Monday.
I had to sign on the dole on Monday.
sentences.cn: 我只好于星期一办理了领取失业救济金的登记。

sentences.en: I went back to work on Monday.
It was a Monday, so she was at home.
sentences.cn: 那天是星期一，因此她在家里。

sentences.en: She travels to Korea on Monday.
The orchestra gave its first performance on Whit Monday.
sentences.cn: 乐团在周一的圣灵降临节举行了首场演出。

sentences.en: The premiere on Monday is sold out.
sentences.cn: 周一首映式的门票已经全部售完。

sentences.en: The president announced Monday that he would cancel the debt.
sentences.cn: 总统周一宣布他会取消这笔债务。

sentences.en: The Prime Minister is expected to call a crunch meeting on Monday.
sentences.cn: 预计首相将于周一召开紧急会议。

sentences.en: Wendy popped in for a quick bite to eat on Monday night.
sentences.cn: 温迪周一晚上过来匆匆吃了点儿饭。

phrases.tran_cn: 黑色的星期一（指股市大跌经常出现在星期一的现象）；复活节后的星期一

trans.tran_en: the day between Sunday and Tuesday
the day between Sunday and Tuesday
